etymology.description: Semantic 行(行) (háng, "street") + phonetic 𩠐 + semantic 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") -> 亍 disappears, components combine into 辵 -> final form 道
etymology.interpretation: The character 道(dào) combines elements associated with a street and foot to convey the meaning of a path or way. The evolution and merging of components reflect the concept of movement along a path, ultimately forming the character we recognize today.

examples.chinese: 我们走上正道(我們走上正道)。
古人通过修身达道(古人通過修身達道)，探求自然的法则(探求自然的法則)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén tōngguò xiūshēn dá dào, tànqiú zìrán de fǎzé.
examples.english: Ancient people attained the Tao through self-cultivation and sought the laws of nature.

examples.chinese: 武术不仅是一种技艺(武術不僅是一種技藝)，更是一种修道之路(更是一種修道之路)。
examples.pinyin: Wǔshù bùjǐn shì yī zhǒng jìyì, gèng shì yī zhǒng xiūdào zhī lù.
examples.english: Martial arts is not only a skill, but also a path of self-cultivation.
